intro: Lomaria varians, commonly known as the variable lomaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, where it typically grows in dry, rocky soils. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Lomaria varians is known for its adaptability to arid conditions and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
